name: Chef de projet électronique H/F
description:
Adoc Talent Management recherche pour son client un Chef de projet électronique H/F. Notre client est un acteur majeur sur le secteur du petit équipement domestique. Sa dynamique innovante lui a permis de se positionner sur plusieurs marques aussi complémentaires qu’influentes. Son positionnement international lui permet et le pousse à être en permanence à la pointe de la technologie et être pionnier sur ses activités.

Poste

Au sein du Bureau d’études Electronique, dans le cadre de développement produit grand public, vous prenez en charge des projets électroniques, des recherches de solutions techniques alternatives et de productivité (seconde source). Vous pilotez transversalement et coordonnez l’action d’une équipe pluridisciplinaire (ingénieurs et techniciens Hardware & Software, Achat, Qualité, Méthode). Une bonne compréhension périphérique et des contraintes métiers de l’équipe projet permettra de développer un climat de confiance.

Vous êtes garant des objectifs coût, qualité, délai des projets tout au long du process, et intervenez durant les phases d’architecture, de définition technique, de validation et de mise en production. Vous identifiez les risques projet, le chiffrage, le planning, l’animation de l’équipe et les reportings. Durant la phase de développement, vous menez la réalisation des prototypes, la validation et les essais pour la mise au point du Hardware.

Le poste est à pourvoir, en CDI, à Saint-Lô, près de Caen (Normandie)

Profil

Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme d’ingénieur ou un master en électronique et vous avez des compétences en logiciel embarqué. Vous disposez d’une expérience de 3 ans en gestion de projets électroniques pour des applications industrielles variées. Vous avez une culture avérée des systèmes embarqués à microprocesseur, vous connaissez les méthodologies et outils de pilotage de projet.

Un bon niveau d’anglais technique oral et écrit est indispensable.

Vous êtes reconnu pour votre capacité d’analyse, de synthèse et d’argumentation et votre aptitude à gérer les priorités vous permet de travailler sur plusieurs projets en simultané. Véritable fédérateur, vous avez une réelle hauteur de vue et une capacité à voir les situations dans leur globalité. Ouvert d’esprit, vous êtes à l’écoute de vos collaborateurs et savez rebondir sur les différentes propositions, tout en vous adaptant à différents environnements culturels.

Si vous souhaitez évoluer au sein d’un Groupe résolument tourné vers l’innovation, l’international et favorisant le développement individuel et que vous avez le goût pour les challenges, alors merci d’envoyer au plus vite votre candidature à Adoc Talent Management (www.adoc-tm.com).

name: Senior Human Resources Business Partner
description:
****ENGLISH VERSION FOLLOWS****

Nous recrutons, pour l'équipe HRBP d'une grande firme internationale américaine (Boston) de conseil en économie, un Partenaire d'affaires en ressources humaines pour leur bureau de Montréal composé d'une centaine d'employés et différents Partners du Groupe. Au sein de cette firme présente en Amérique du Nord, en Europe et en Asie, vous superviserez les ressources humaines du bureau ainsi que de l'équipe science de données répartie entre Boston et Montréal, sous la direction de la Head of HR Business Partenership.

Vos défis

  • Consulter les dirigeants de l'entreprise pour créer une expérience positive et intégrée pour les employés ; fournir des conseils et des orientations aux dirigeants et aux managers pour développer et motiver les individus et les équipes.
  • Mener des discussions de haute qualité sur la performance et la rémunération, guider l'analyse des données de rémunération, et fournir des conseils sur les promotions, le développement de carrière et les problèmes de performance.
  • Conseiller les employés et les dirigeants sur des sujets liés aux RH, y compris l'interprétation des politiques et des avantages sociaux, les licenciements et les problèmes de performance.
  • Gérer et résoudre les problèmes de relations avec les employés. Mener des enquêtes efficaces, approfondies et objectives et consulter les dirigeants sur les recommandations.
  • Fournir des conseils et des avis d'experts aux chefs d'entreprise et à l'ensemble de l'équipe RH sur les pratiques de travail canadiennes, telles que le droit du travail, la conformité et les congés.
    • Conseiller sur les bonnes pratiques de conformité des entreprises et sur les modifications à apporter aux pratiques actuelles, le cas échéant.
    • Fournir des conseils pratiques et un soutien concernant la conformité à l'OQLF, y compris la gestion de l'administration et la mise en œuvre des exigences pour le bureau de Montréal.
  • Diriger et/ou participer à des projets et des initiatives de RH à l'échelle mondiale afin d'améliorer l'expérience des employés et/ou de gérer les pratiques de RH ; fournir une perspective locale aux projets et initiatives de RH.
  • Collaborer avec l'équipe mondiale des RH à la gestion de l'examen annuel du rendement des employés et du processus de rémunération pour le bureau de Montréal et d'autres secteurs d'activité désignés.
  • Collaborer avec l'équipe de recrutement et gestionnaires pour le recrutement et l'intégration des nouveaux employés, et avec les équipes des RH et de la paie pour faciliter les congés, évaluer et mettre en œuvre les avantages sociaux locaux, et résoudre les problèmes de paie.

Votre profil

  • Diplôme de niveau Baccalauréat et plusieurs années d’expérience professionnelle pertinente 
  • Connaissance approfondie et application préalable des pratiques de travail, des avantages sociaux, du droit du travail et des règlements légaux canadiens (OQLF, audits salariaux) exigées

Atouts

  • Connaissance et application préalable des lois américaines sur l'emploi

________________________________________________________________

We are recruiting for the HRBP team of a large international US (Boston) economic consulting firm., a Human Resources Business Partner for their Montreal office composed of about a hundred people and different Group partners . As part of this firm with operations in North America, Europe and Asia, you will oversee the human resources of the office as well as the data science team split between Boston and Montreal, under the supervision of the Head of HR Business Partenership

Job

  • Consult with business leaders to create a positive and integrated employee experience; provide guidance and consulting to leaders and managers to develop and motivate individuals and teams.
  • Lead high quality performance and compensation discussions, guide compensation data analysis, and provide guidance around promotions, career development, and performance concerns.
  • Counsel employees and leaders on HR-related topics, including policy and benefits interpretation and terminations and performance issues.
  • Manage and resolve employee relations issues. Conduct effective, thorough, and objective investigations and consult to leaders on recommendations.
  • Provide expert guidance and council to business leaders and the broader HR team on Canadian labor practices, such as employment law, compliance, and leaves of absence.
    • Advise on proper business compliance practices and modifications to current practices as needed.
    • Provide practical advice and support relating to OQLF compliance, including managing the administration and implementing requirements for the Montreal office
  • Lead and/or participate in global HR projects and initiatives to enhance the employee experience and/or manage HR practices; provide local perspective to HR projects and initiatives.
  • Collaborate with global HR team on management of annual employee performance review and compensation process for Montreal office and other assigned business areas.
  • Partner with Recruiting team and managers for recruitment and onboarding of new employees, and with HR and payroll teams to facilitate leaves of absence, assess and implement local benefits, and resolve payroll issues.

Profile

  • Bachelor’s degree with several years of relevant work experience
  • Deep knowledge and prior application of Canadian labor practices, benefits, employment law, and statutory regulations (i.e., OQLF, pay audits) required

Assets

  • Knowledge and prior application of US employment laws

name: Mechatronics Specialist (M/F)
description:
Enterprise

Adoc Talent Management is looking for a Mechatronics Specialist (M/F). Our client is a Biotech scale up in the development and industrialization of innovative temperature controller perfusion systems for cell biology. It is a fast-growing deeptech start-up that provides an integrative and innovative platform which automates and improves the 3D cell culture in the objective of drug development and toxicity. The dynamic and human-sized team offers a very stimulating work environment, encouraging autonomy and creativity.

Position

Within the R&D department, you will be in charge of the optimization and hardware/software architecture of the current device, and the development of next generation devices.

Being an expert in mechatronics, you will be expected to take the role of a scientific referent on building the mechanical and electronic parts of the device, and managing your teams’ scientific efforts by providing your expertise in the domain.

Having a solid knowledge in the assemblance of electronic cards, software controllers, and programming languages, you will be expected to control the industrialization and user safety of any implemented solution on your device, while ensuring the delivery of your tasks and managing your deadlines.

You will be playing a vital role in being a scientific monitor, hence presenting and implementing solutions to any potential challenge in the objective of ensuring the efficiency and scalability of the device, thus you will be constantly building hypotheses, testing, and identifying solutions.

In close collaboration with the CTO, you will be proactive in brainstorming, proposing new idea, and reporting your ongoing tasks and providing a high level of communication and collaboration.

The position is to be filled in Ile de France as soon as possible.

Profile


You are a junior PhD holder in mechatronics, electronics, or robotics, with an experience building electronic or robotic prototypes.

You show strong interest in the health care field, and passionate about engineering with a hand- on attitude. You are recognized as an expert in python programming language. C and C++ would be a plus.

To collaborate and integrate efficiently in a small sized team and fit in the company’s culture, you show up excellent team working, engagement, and interpersonal skills, and noticeably English proficiency, French would be a plus. 

You are highly organized, attentive to detail, dynamic, and proactive.
Far-sighted, able to anticipate and multitask in a versatile environment, efficient with a desire to innovate.

Looking for a Mechatronics Specialist position where you will grow your skills while working in an innovative environment to save thousands of lives? Do not hesitate to send your application (detailed CV + publications and patents + motivation + salary expectations) to Adoc Talent Management.

name: Research Grant Coordinator (M/F)
description:
Enterprise

Adoc Talent Management is looking for a Research Grant Coordinator (M/F). Our client is a Biotech scale up in the development and industrialization of innovative temperature controller perfusion systems for cell biology. It is a fast-growing deeptech start-up that provides an integrative and innovative platform which automates and improves the 3D cell culture in the objective of drug development and toxicity. The dynamic and human sized team offers a very stimulating work environment, encouraging autonomy and creativity.

As a key role in your team, you will have a complete understanding of your company’s strategy and objectives. Your main mission will be to support your team in the application, execution, organization, supervision, and closing phases of public-tender scientific calls (i.e., Horizon, ANR, etc..).

You will be in charge of overseeing public tender scientific projects calls, calendars, events and potential opportunities while ensuring all parties are synchronized and diverse activities such as meetings, deadlines, milestones are communicated and coordinated with the CTO.

Being an expert in public-tender managing portals (i.e., EU horizon portal), you will be expected to set up the main organizational tools to execute co writings, join calls, generate financial reports, and take over the overall communication and administrative tasks making sure you manage your deadlines, and you deliver tasks on time.

As a representative of your company, you will be managing relations with the diplomacy, joining meetings to present your company and its objectives, and producing content for the projects you are managing such as presentations, prototypes, emails, and articles.

In close collaboration with the CTO, you will be proactive in brainstorming, proposing new idea, reporting your ongoing tasks and providing a high level of communication and collaboration, thanks to your project management skills and knowledge in biomedical and biological disciplines.

Profile


You hold a PhD in engineering or applied physics, with interest and knowledge in biomedical and biological disciplines, and experience building prototypes and conducting experiments related to mechanical devices and microfluid systems.

name: Senior Data Engineer (M/F)
description:
Enterprise

Adoc Talent Management is looking for a Senior Data Engineer (M/F). Our client is a MedTech scale up in remote patient monitoring and cardiac data management solutions. It is a fast-growing start-up providing a cutting-edge innovative platform that permits an effectual patient care using machine learning and data generated from different health data hubs in order to help professionals predicting and monitoring patient’s health status. The dynamic and human-sized team offers a very stimulating work environment, encouraging autonomy and creativity.


Position

As a part of the data team, you will bring your technical expertise, noticeably, your expertise in AWS services, ETL, python, and coding and data modelling while reporting to the head of data.

Your main objective will be to stimulate scalability by facilitating the data access, and to help in the transition of the approach from a monolithic architecture to a Kafka combined with cloud microservices approach.

Your will be expected to use your data modelling skills to build, maintain and optimize efficient and scalable pipelines, and also to architect the company’s DataMart, while understanding, assessing and mapping the data landscape. 

You will be playing a vital role in transmitting your technical knowledge in different areas, such as data modelling, AWS services to your team members.  

Moreover, in close collaboration with your manager, you will be proactive in proposing new ideas to build analytical systems and predictive models, and working together to constantly improve your skills.


The position is to be filled in Paris as soon as possible.

Profile

You hold a master’s / engineering degree in data science/engineering or in a relevant discipline, completed with at least 6 years of experience, ideally in stack construction with large volumes of data and open-source code / software development. An experience on health data or medical device software would be a plus.

You are recognized as an expert in AWS, data modelling, document-oriented database (i.e., MariaDB, PostgreSQL, MongoDB) and can transfer best practices to your colleagues. You possess working knowledge in Kafka in which you are willing to improve your skills, the implementation of scalable data pipelines using agile methodologies such as Scrum and CI/CD.  

To collaborate efficiently with your fellow colleagues and fit in the company’s culture, you show up excellent analytical, project management and interpersonal skills, and English and French proficiency.

You are highly organized, attentive to detail, autonomous, far-sighted, able to anticipate and
multitask in a versatile environment. You are recognized as a team player, efficient with a desire to innovate.  

Looking for a Senior Data Engineer position where you will grow your skills while working in an innovative environment to save thousands of lives? Do not hesitate to send your application (detailed CV + motivation + salary expectations) to Adoc Talent Management.

name: Research Director - Biology
description:
Reference: AMB-ATM22121A | Sector: Biotechnologies | Contract: Permanent | Location: Villejuif (France)

Company

Our client is a private international cell and gene therapy company focused on the natural power of the body to cure disease. It develops cutting-edge technologies aiming to demonstrate potential for the treatment of a broad range of serious diseases across oncology, cardiovascular, neurological and ocular diseases, and genetic disorders.

Building on its success, this company, multi-located across Europe, is looking for an inspirational head of Chemistry managing a team of scientists designing and developing cell therapies based on its exciting in vivo gene delivery platform.

Position

The candidate will work seamlessly across all functions to evaluate the biological properties, mechanism of action, efficacy and safety of drug candidates, aligned with corporate goals and objectives and within the allocated budget.

In addition to the oversight of laboratory experimental work, this position embraces the performance management and development of the Biology team members, compliance with health and safety regulations, and adherence to data integrity policies.



Main missions:

  • Design, execution and coordination of experimental strategy and plans
  • Development, validation and implementation of cellular models
  • Design and production of experimental tools required for the fulfillment of the company’s research and development plans
  • Operational management of the labs
  • Leading and management of an internal team comprising technicians, senior technicians, engineers and PhDs
  • Review and validation of study plans and internal reports (for both in vitro and in vivo studies)
  • Writing, review and validation of technical documents (SOP, WI, REC…) and health and safety procedures linked to lab activities
  • Preparation of scientific documents for senior leadership, board meetings and due diligence for investors and industrial partners
  • Involvement in the dissemination of company’s scientific results (patents, scientific publications, communications at international conferences)
  • Preparation/renewal of GMO application dossiers, follow-up of interactions with competent authorities
  • Preparation and writing of annual CIR dossier (in French)



Profile

You hold a PhD with specialization in cell and molecular biology. You have at least 5 years of experience in a biotech or pharma environment out of academia.

Strong skills in multicolor flow cytometry is compulsory, preferably with experience in immune-oncology
Expertise in cell-based assay development is compulsory

Excellent knowledge of plasmid engineering and proficiency in handling molecular biology software are highly desirable
Experience in in vivo gene therapy is compulsory and experience in immunotherapy is highly desirable.
Expertise in lentiviral vectors and knowledge of GLP highly preferable

Fluency in French is mandatory and a good command of English is necessary as well.
Able to work in a cross-functional, matrix environment, you are familiar with working within a quality assurance system
Experienced in developing high performing teams and endowed excellent leadership capabilities and with an enterprising, dynamic and operational spirit, you have a taste for challenge and a sense of responsibility.
You are agile and pro-active and demonstrate a high level of autonomy.

Determined and organized, you are a thorough person with a strong team spirit and faculty to adapt together with good communication skills.



Contributing to the growth of a highly innovative biotech company tempts you? Send immediately your resume + list of publications & patents + cover letter to Adoc Talent Management!

name: HEAD OF CHEMISTRY
description:
The company

Our client is a private UK-based cell and gene therapy company focused on the natural power of the body to cure disease. It develops cutting-edge technologies aiming to demonstrate potential for the treatment of a broad range of serious diseases across oncology, cardiovascular, neurological and ocular diseases, and genetic disorders.

Building on its success, this company, multi-located across Europe, is looking for an inspirational head of Chemistry managing a team of scientists designing and developing cell therapies based on its exciting in vivo gene delivery platform.

Missions

The candidate will have expertise in polymer chemistry in the context of designing, building and optimizing encapsulated nanoparticles for cell and gene therapy. Working seamlessly across all functions, the candidate will play a major role in determining the biological properties, mode of action, efficacy and safety of drug candidates, aligned with the corporate goals and objectives, and within allocated budget. 

In addition to having oversight of the laboratory experimental work, this position embraces the performance management and personal development of the chemistry team members, compliance with health and safety regulations and adherence to data integrity policies.

You earn a scientific background (PhD level minimum) with specialization in polymer chemistry  and knowledge of biochemistry, molecular biology and vector encapsulation. You have at least 5 years of experience in a biotech or pharma environment out of academia. 

You have experience in the use of polymer chemistry in the context of gene delivery applications

Experience in in vivo gene therapy is compulsory and experience in immunotherapy is highly desirable.

Fluency in French is mandatory and a good command of English is necessary as well.

IT tools proficiency is required

Endowed with an enterprising, dynamic and co-operational spirit, you enjoy challenge and have a strong sense of responsibility and accountability

Able to set and implement strategy with the agility to change direction when needed, you are data driven and analytical

 You have the ability to create an excellent, diverse, cultural environment and to build high performing teams

You demonstrate a high level of autonomy and are proactive

Determined and organized, you are a thorough person with a strong team spirit and excellent communication skills.

Référence : AMB-ATM22121B | Secteur : Biotechnologies | Contrat : CDI | Localisation : Villejuif (France)|

Entreprise

Notre client est une biotech internationale de thérapie cellulaire et génique qui se concentre sur le pouvoir naturel du corps à guérir les maladies. Elle développe des technologies de pointe visant à démontrer leur potentiel pour le traitement d'un large éventail de maladies graves dans les domaines de l'oncologie, des maladies cardiovasculaires, neurologiques et oculaires, et des troubles génétiques.

Forte de son succès, cette entreprise, implantée dans plusieurs pays d'Europe, recherche un·e directeur·rice de la chimie motivé·e pour diriger une équipe de scientifiques qui conçoivent et développent des thérapies cellulaires basées sur sa plateforme d'administration de gènes in vivo.

Poste

Le·a candidat·e apportera son expertise en chimie des polymères dans le contexte de la conception, de la construction et de l'optimisation de nanoparticules encapsulées pour la thérapie cellulaire et génique. Travaillant de manière avec les autres équipes scientifiques, le candidat jouera un rôle majeur dans la détermination des propriétés biologiques, du mode d'action, de l'efficacité et de la sécurité des candidats médicaments, en accord avec les buts et objectifs de l'entreprise et dans le respect du budget alloué.

En plus de superviser le travail expérimental du laboratoire, ce poste englobe la gestion des performances et le développement personnel des membres de l'équipe de chimie, la conformité aux règlements de santé et de sécurité et le respect des politiques d'intégrité des données.

Principales fonctions :

- Conception, exécution et coordination de la stratégie et des plans expérimentaux.

- Mise en œuvre de systèmes modèles pertinents pour le profilage et l'optimisation des nanoparticules encapsulées.

- Conception et production des outils expérimentaux nécessaires

- Gestion de projets externes des CRO

- Rédaction, révision et validation de documents techniques

- Préparation de matériel scientifique pour les dirigeants, les réunions du conseil d'administration, les investisseurs et les partenaires industriels

- Participation à la diffusion des résultats scientifiques de l'entreprise (brevets, publications scientifiques, communications lors de conférences internationales)

- Soutien technique pour les documents nécessaires à la mise en œuvre de la stratégie réglementaire

- Préparation et rédaction du dossier CIR annuel (en français) et des propositions de subventions.

Profil

Vous êtes titulaire d'un doctorat avec une spécialisation en chimie des polymères, nanomatériaux pour la santé, nanomédecine. Vous avez au moins 5 ans d'expérience dans un environnement biotech ou pharma.

Vous avez une expérience dans l'utilisation de la chimie des polymères dans le cadre d'applications de genes delivery ou siRNA... Vous savez définir des stratégie de binding, designer, synthétiser, formuler, caractériser des nanoparticules. Outre les polymères, une expérience sur les aptamères ou les liposomes est intéressante . La maîtrise du français est obligatoire et une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais est également nécessaire.

Doté·e d'un esprit entrepreneurial, de dynamisme et de coopération, vous aimez les défis et avez un sens aigu des responsabilités. Vous êtes capable de définir et de mettre en œuvre une stratégie, tout en ayant la souplesse nécessaire pour changer de direction, et vous êtes axé·e sur les données et l'analyse. Vous avez la capacité de créer un environnement culturel excellent et diversifié et de constituer des équipes performantes. Vous faites preuve d'un haut niveau d'autonomie et êtes proactif·ve. Déterminé·e et organisé·e, vous êtes une personne minutieuse avec un fort esprit d'équipe et d'excellentes compétences en communication.

Le poste est situé à Villejuif (accessible en métro, Paris, France).

Contribuer à la croissance d'une société de biotechnologie hautement innovante vous tente ? Envoyez immédiatement votre CV + liste des publications & brevets + lettre de motivation à Adoc Talent Management !

name: Inside Sales - Analytical Instruments - Biopharma
description:
Company

Adoc Talent Management is looking for an Inside Sales Specialist- Analytical instruments - Biopharma. This company develops and markets state-of-the-art solutions (chromatography, mass spectrometry, spectroscopy) and constantly increases its market share in the pharma/biotech sector.

Position

As part of the inside sales team and in collaboration with key account managers, you will be expected to grow sales revenue of both chromatography analytical techniques and atomic & molecular spectroscopy solutions with a wide range of product portfolio (i.e., GC, HPLC) for existing and potential clients in the Pharma/ Biopharma domain.

You will be playing a vital role in driving business deal on the market and handling complex annual and multi-annual sales cycles and product activities in your market and maintaining an effective sales strategy, thus you are expected to respond to customer inquiries and incoming requests, in addition to developing a solid post sales process while offering an excellent technical assistance thanks to your scientific and technical background and knowledge in atomic and molecular spectroscopy and chromatography instruments as well as your hunter and sales driven mentality.

You will be constantly thriving for innovative ways to prospect and bring in new business opportunities and onboarding new leads, leading the entire process smoothly and efficiently by providing excellent communication, building long term relationships and a loyal database of clients.

Furthermore, you are expected to be collaborating with key account managers, fellow sales specialists, and colleagues in marketing, product line, and support teams to suggest sales strategies and ensure the availability of resources.

Throughout your role, you will be actively updating the CRM with clients and business opportunities information while achieving KPIs and annual sales targets.

The position is to be filled as soon as possible and is to be based in the Ile de France or Barcelona.

Profile

You hold a Bachelor or master’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, or Life Science, with a deep knowledge in atomic & molecular spectroscopy and chromatography, ideally with an experience in GC, HPLC, ICP-MS, ICP-OES, UV-Vis and FTIR, and a knowledge in the BiPharma workflow and LC-MS triple quad. A hands-on experience in a laboratory is a plus.


Thanks to your communication skills and sales driven mentality, you have a potential in managing complex sales, prospecting, customer acquisition and engaging clients in long term relationships. A prior experience in sales would be a plus.

To collaborate efficiently with the clients, you show up excellent interpersonal skills and noticeably both French and English proficiency.

You are sales enthusiast, dynamic, confident, and open-minded. Autonomous, far-sighted, able to anticipate, coordinate, multitask and collaborate in a versatile environment, you are recognized as a hunter, with a desire to innovate.

Looking for an inside sales position where you will grow your skills while working in an innovative international environment? Do not hesitate to send your application (detailed CV + motivations + salary expectations) to Adoc Talent Management.

name: Deep Learning Researcher
description:
For French see bellow

Deep Learning Researcher M/F

Reference : AMB-ATM22004E | Business sector : Biotech | Contract type : Permanent | Region : Ile-de-France | City : Paris or Remote

Company

Adoc Talent Management is currently recruiting for our client a Deep Learning Researcher M/F. Our Client is a startup that disrupts in silico approaches for drug discovery by creating a digital twin of the cell. This relies on the combination of state-of-the-art artificial intelligence technologies, system engineering and  omics data analysis.  After setting up collaborations with leaders in the pharmaceutical sector and the best academic laboratories in the field, the company is now strengthening its team.

Position

Reporting to the CTO and working closely with the computational/systems biologists, bioinformaticians and developers, you will be in charge of an internal R&D project participating in the implementation of the digital twin technology of the cell.

As a referent expert in deep or reinforcement learning, you will propose and lead research projects in an autonomous way: scientific and technological watch, implementation of projects and valorization of results through their production, but also, via scientific publications and conferences.

In some areas, you will participate in collaborative research programs with international laboratories and will be able to establish new academic partnerships.

The position, offering a real autonomy in its missions, is to be filled as soon as possible, on a permanent basis, in Paris, but can also be considered for telecommuting from another location in France or abroad.

Profile

You have a PhD in deep or reinforcement learning for simulation (neural ODE, causal inference, differentiable physics, ...), possibly completed by post-doc in academic laboratories.

You are interested in artificial intelligence and its applications to the health field. You have developed state-of-the-art expertise in the development of learning models and algorithms based on neural network architectures and ideally their deployment. You have trained your algorithms on unstructured data to extract relevant information. You have developed Python packages. Knowledge of model-based reinforcement learning is desirable. Experience with biological data, especially omics, would be a plus, as well as mastery of R programming.

Agile, dynamic and a strong team player, your temperament allows you to play a leading role in your projects. Good communicator and liking to learn alone and from others, you enjoy working in a multidisciplinary team. You are creative and enjoy technical challenges. Because of the international team within the company, you are fluent in English and ideally in French. In order to be at ease in a start-up environment, your autonomy, your versatility, your pragmatism, your sense of organization and time management are important assets.

Send your application (CV, list of publications, GitHub repository, motivations and salary expectations) to Adoc Talent Management without further delay!

Référence : AMB-ATM22004E | Secteur d'activité : Biotech | Type de contrat : CDI | Région : Ile-de-France | Ville : Paris ou Remote

Entreprise

Adoc Talent Management recrute pour son client un·e Deep Learning Researcher H/F. Notre client est une startup qui révolutionne les approches in silico en support au drug discovery via la création d’un jumeau digital de la cellule, grâce à une combinaison de technologies de rupture à la croisée de l’intelligence artificielle, de l’ingénierie des systèmes et de l’analyse des données omics.  Forte de collaborations avec des leaders du secteur pharmaceutique et les meilleurs laboratoires académiques du domaine, la société renforce aujourd’hui son équipe.

Poste

Rattaché·e au CTO et en étroite collaboration avec les computational/systems biologists, bioinformaticiens et les développeurs,  vous prendrez en charge un projet de R&D interne participant à la mise en place de la technologie de jumeau numérique de la cellule.

En tant que référent·e expert·e en deep ou reinforcement learning, vous proposerez et mènerez des projets de recherche de manière autonome : veille scientifique et technologique, implémentation des projets et valorisation des résultats à travers leur mise en production, mais également, via des publications scientifiques et conférences.

Sur certains axes, vous participerez à des programmes de recherche collaborative avec des laboratoires internationaux et pourrez monter de nouveaux partenariats académiques.

Le poste, offrant une réelle autonomie dans ses missions, est à pourvoir au plus vite, en CDI, à Paris, mais peut tout à fait être envisagé en télétravail depuis une autre localisation en France ou à l’international.

Profil

Vous êtes titulaire d’un doctorat en deep ou reinforcement learning pour la simulation (neural ODE, causal inference, differentiable physics, …), éventuellement complété par des post-doc dans des laboratoires académiques.

Vous êtes interessé·e par l’intelligence artificielle et ses applications au domaine de la santé. Vous avez développé une expertise à la pointe de l’état de l’art dans le développement de modèles et d’algorithmes d’apprentissage reposant sur des architectures de réseaux de neurones et idéalement leur déploiement. Vous avez entrainé vos algorithmes sur des données non structurées pour en extraire des informations pertinentes. Vous avez développé des package Python. Une connaissance en model-based reinforcement learning est souhaitée. Une expérience en lien avec des données biologiques notamment omics serait un plus, ainsi que la maitrise de la programmation en R.

Agile, force de proposition et dynamique, votre tempérament vous permet de jouer un rôle moteur dans vos projets. Bon·ne communicant·e et aimant apprendre seul·e et des autres, vous appréciez le travail en équipe pluridisciplinaire. Vous êtes créatif·ve et aimez les défis techniques. Du fait de l’équipe internationale au sein de la société, vous maîtrisez l’anglais et idéalement le français. Afin d’être à l’aise dans un fonctionnement start’up, votre autonomie, votre polyvalence, votre pragmatisme, votre sens de l’organisation et de la gestion du temps sont des atouts importants.

Envoyez sans plus tarder votre candidature (CV, liste des publications, GitHub repository, motivations et attentes salariales) à Adoc Talent Management !

name: Chief Executive Officer - Drug development startup
description:
Do you want to take on a new, high-impact challenge? Do you want to help revolutionize the next generation antibiotics market?  Come and bring your expertise in drug development and your team leadership to a great startup whose goal is to save lives!

The company

Adoc Talent Management is recruiting the Chief Executive Officer for its client, an ambitious Biotech startup developing a new generation of antibiotics. They are developing first-in-class, novel generations of drugs to fight multiple resistant pathogens (by targeting enzymes). The scientific projects led by brilliant and successful scientists are very promising and open many markets. The company has already raised funds and has the ambition to go further with a new round planned. The company now needs a leader, an expert in (preclinical) drug development, who can guide the company through the different steps and processes to move towards obtaining INDs.

Your Role

The main role will be to lead the startup and make most executive decisions related to the business

Your daily task will consist in:

  • Ensuring the implementation of the existing business plan, strategic planning, and business development
  • Managing of drug development and structuring of a start-up
  • Defining, optimizing, and adapting the steps to be taken, the tests and experiments to be carried out and to identify the relevant partner(s).
  • Building positive relationships with stakeholders and other business leaders, stakeholders and (private or public) investors.
  • Fundraising and board reporting
  • Being an inspirational leader, taking on a big, high-impact challenge.
  • Being able to drive the company's projects forward to achieve milestones (including IND).

Profile

You have:

  • A degree (PhD or MD) in biological or medical sciences e.g., biotechnology, bioengineering, biochemistry, microbiology (or a related field) (an MBA is a plus)
  • at least 10 years of experience in managing a start-up (Biotech) in the drug development sector (discovery and preclinical).
  • A Strong ability to run a company (startup, biotech)
  • A strong knowledge of the drug development processes, needs and constraints
  • Excellent managerial skills (team and projects) & social skills
  • A talent for managing relationships with investors and partners
  • Strong hierarchical and matrix leadership skills, with experience in building and motivating teams.

You are a(n):

  • Energetic and ambitious person
  • Ambassador of the company, has easy contact with external partners (private and public investors, CROs, labs, biotech & pharma)
  • Excellent communicator, communicative & open-minded
  • Positive person with a strong work ethic, team spirit and self-motivation.
  • Born entrepreneur, dynamic, reactive, and able to adapt to change.
  • Flexible and agile
  • Resilient & proactive
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken), knowledge of French is an asset

You like to see your real contribution and impact on life-saving projects.

The position will be located in Belgium (Mont-Saint-Guibert).

If the challenge calls for you and you want to contribute to this great success by going to the jungle to find the treasure, this could be the job for you! This market, which has not evolved for 40 years, is now ripe for the development of new generations of antibiotics. Be part of it!

If you feel you are a good fit for the role and the company, please send your application (CV and cover letter) to Adoc Talent Management.

name: R&D Scientist in new antimicrobial drugs development (in a spinoff) M/F
description:
Do you want to help revolutionize the next generation of antimicrobials to fight deadly pathogens and save lives? Is doing a postdoc in a spinoff and developing skills for industry and biotech part of your career plan?

The company

Adoc Talent Management is recruiting a R&D Scientist in new antimicrobial drugs development for its client, an ambitious Biotech spinoff developing a novel generation of antimicrobials to fight multiple resistant pathogens (by targeting enzymes). You are a(n):

  • Self-disciplined and responsible
  • Eager to learn
  • Positive person with a strong work ethic and a strong team spirit and self-motivation

If the challenge calls for you and you want to contribute to this great success by going to the jungle to find the treasure, this could be the job for you!

name: React.js Frontend Lead F/M
description:
Reference : AMB-ATM22004F | Business sector : Biotech | Contract type : Permanent | Region : Ile-de-France | City : Paris or Remote

Company

Adoc Talent Management is currently recruiting for our client a React.js FrontEnd Lead M/F. Our Client is a startup that disrupts in silico approaches for drug discovery by creating a digital twin of the cell. Backed by international investors and developing the first SaaS platform for cellular engineering, the company is now strengthening its team. The team develops a SaaS platform embedding state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms on single cell multi-omics data, public and private cell atlases and proprietary deep learning cell engineering tools. The goal is to replace in vitro testing by in silico simulations and rapidly discover molecular triggers to efficiently engineer cell behavior. They are closely working with pharmaceutical industry and biotechs to accelerate their target identification processes. They are also collaborating actively with the academic community by publishing publications and providing open access to data and features on the platform.

Position

As React.js Frontend Lead, you will:

  • Develop the frontend part of the discovery web app. The current stack is FastAPI, Django ORM, PostgreSQL, React.js.
  • Contribute to the design of the product within cloud native architecture (host in GCP)
  • Team work within a Scrum framework
  • Code review and peer coding with other developer to deliver high quality code (clean code, static and dynamic tests, documentation…)
  • Monitor and maintain the production app

The position, offering a real autonomy in its missions, is to be filled as soon as possible, on a permanent basis, in Paris, but can also be considered for telecommuting from another location in France or abroad.

Profile

Minimum:

  • Significant experience (3+ years) with javascript including React.js
  • Significant experience in data visualization
  • Skills to produce high quality code (readability, testing, review...)
  • Enthusiast with team work
  • Ease to communicate with tech and non tech fellows

Nice to have:

  • Professional or academical experience in science, biology or machine learning
  • Skills in Python in a scientific or web context

Send your application (CV, GitHub repository, motivations and salary expectations) to Adoc Talent Management without further delay!

name: ASIC Project Leader (permanent position)
description:
Our client is one of the most promising engineering consultancies in Belgium. With a strong involvement in many fields of engineering (automotive, aeronautics, aerospace...), they offer to work with SMEs and large industrial groups to help them realize their projects. With their offices in Brussels, they are centrally located to provide qualified engineering solutions throughout Belgium.

With a team of over 50 engineers, their mission is to use the technical background and entrepreneurial spirit of their engineers to provide customized solutions to their customers.

The role

Our client is looking for an ASIC Project Leader with some industry experience in this prior area. The future consultant must be able to lead projects from A to Z. 

Your main tasks will be:

  • Setting up the ASIC test solution with the test house
  • Preparing test solutions, writing test specifications
  • Discussing the ASIC prototype-to-production volume ramp plan with the customer including characterization & qualification
  • Organizing volume production after the volume ramp phase

Qualifications & Experience

You hold a degree (BS, MSc and/or PhD) in Engineering (preferably micro-electronic) or a related sector with at least 3 to 5 years’ experience in contributing to IC R&D projects.

You have a(n):

  • Knowledge & hands-on experience with system simulation & ASIC design tools and programming languages.
  • Good knowledge of common analog IPs and good knowledge of statistical analysis
  • Hands-on experience with automated test equipment

  • Preferably knowledge of PLC
  • Ability to lead the testing and design phase
  • Ability to do the testing reports and their review
  • Experience in developing the ASIC’s prototypes and ability to deliver it to the client
  • Ability to welcome and manage client relationships
  • Proven ability to work effectively in multi-disciplinary & multicultural teams
  • Excellent interpersonal & communication skills
  • Readiness to be challenged outside your comfort zone to achieve top results.
  • Fluent in English and a natural communicator in a multi-disciplinary team.

You are a(n):

  • Quick learner, able to identify & research new ASIC & network technologies.
  • Open-minded person with drive for success.
  • Strong Team-player & Communicative
  • Ambassador of the company
  • Positive person with a strong work ethic, team spirit and self-motivation
  • Entrepreneurial / dynamic mind, responsive, able to adapt to change.
  • Flexible and agile
  • Resilient

If you wish to work in one of the most promising engineering consultancies in Belgium and be able to demonstrate and develop your skills through various missions in microelectronics and ICs through various missions with high added value, do not hesitate to send your application (CV + list of your achievements + motivation letter) to Adoc Talent Management.

name: Team Lead – Discovery BioInsecticides (CDI)
description:
Is contributing to the development of sustainable, effective, safe, and innovative BioInsecticides your career aspiration? This offer is for you!

The company

Adoc Talent Management is recruiting a Team Lead – Discovery BioInsecticides for its client, a fast-growing crop protection and food scale-up company developing a new generation of protein-based biocontrol solutions. Based on their ground-breaking technology platform, they have developed a broad pipeline of effective and safe products with novel modes of action, addressing key crop pests and diseases across the whole value chain, from soil to plate.

Your Role

You will lead a small team and use your experience for their bioactive lead characterization and make these ready for further development. You will play a key role in their bioinsecticide strategy and in their lead characterization programs using cutting-edge in vitro technologies.

Your key activities include:

  • Providing scientific leadership and impact through a lab-based role.
  • Playing a key role in the strategy to develop protein based bioinsecticides.
  • Take the lead in outlining the strategy for characterizing bioactive against insects, including target nomination and discovery approach.
  • Delivering high-quality hits and leads using their Lead Characterization platforms. Developing high performing in vitro and on planta assays to assess the efficacy of hit candidates. Design and execute in vitro protocols to characterize bioactive leads against insects.
  • Leading, supporting, and assisting a team of highly talented and motivated scientists (focused on developing people to their full potential).
  • Championing innovative ideas and facilitate the development and implementation of technologies to improve efficiency and decrease cycle times of our lead characterization workflows.
  • Working collaboratively and effectively within multidisciplinary teams.
  • Maintaining high quality records of the hit/lead panels in the databases
  • Developing and maintaining scientific collaborations (with academic labs, Biotech, KOLs, CROs)

You have:

  • a PhD degree (and postdocs) in Entomology, Toxicology; Physiology, Biological Sciences (or related discipline) and at least 5 years of experience in working on technologies to treat and/or control insects.
  • Hands on experience with in vitro characterization of proteins and biologicals.
  • Track record of critiquing scientific data with the ability to identify and resolve scientific questions.
  • Strong line and matrix leadership skills with experience of building and motivating teams.
  • Motivated to drive operational excellence, including support for efficiency/productivity initiatives.
  • Ability to advance multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
  • Track record of building collaborations internally and externally (KOLs, academic labs, CROs...).
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in multi-disciplinary teams and excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Excellent reporting and communication skills (fluent in English, written and spoken).
  • Strong analytical and data interpretations skills.

You are:

  • Assertive
  • A good listener, who communicates clearly and concisely and reports in an excellent way
  • Naturally good at interpersonal relations
  • A positive person with a strong work ethic and motivation
  • Strong Team player

The position will be located in Belgium (Dynamic Cluster in Ghent).

If you adhere to the company's values of innovation, passion, teamwork, accountability, and well-being, and if you enjoy growing and learning in a dynamic and changing environment with ease and pleasure, this could be the job for you!

If you feel you are a good fit for the role and the company, please send your application (CV, list of publications/achievements and cover letter) to Adoc Talent Management.

name: NLP R&D Scientist H/F
description:
Entreprise

Adoc Talent Management recherche pour son client un·e NLP R&D Scientist H/F. Notre client est une start-up en pleine croissance sur le marché de la data quality et de la data intégration/préparation, qui a réalisé une deuxième levée de fonds importante et a aujourd’hui des ambitions internationales, s’appuyant sur un portefeuille client composés de grands comptes. Cette structure innovante a pu développer une solution intelligente pour la normalisation et la correction de données multi-sources. L’équipe, jeune, dynamique et paritaire est issue des quatre coins du monde, et a à cœur de proposer une vraie valeur ajoutée à ses clients, tout en contribuant à la communauté open-source via un outil puissant et utile à tous.

Poste

Vous évoluerez au sein du département tech d’environ 15 personnes et dans une équipe IA composée de 5 personnes dont un PhD, dédiée au développement de l’IA. En tant que référent·e sur les technologies NLP, vous contribuerez à faire évoluer la solution existante pour la rendre plus efficiente, permettant une plus grande automatisation des différentes tâches encore manuelles à ce jour. A l’écoute des clients et en collaboration avec les experts métiers, vous assurerez la bonne compréhension de leurs besoins afin de proposer des solutions toujours plus adaptées à leurs enjeux en matière de gouvernance des données. Vous chercherez à généraliser les problématiques afin de développer une solution la plus universelle possible. Au-delà du décryptage lexical, votre défi sera de lever les verrous technologiques au niveau sémantique et dans l’optimisation de la solution et du temps de réponse dans un contexte de gestion de données massives.

En partant de l’état de l’art, vous serez au cœur de la définition d’une stratégie et de projets de recherche de rupture. Vous vous appuierez sur des méthodes de machine learning et de modélisation de langage à la pointe de l’innovation. En tant que mentor, vous transmettrez vos expertises aux scientifiques de l’équipe.

Dans une optique d’application concrète de vos recherches, vous coderez, implémenterez et testerez les algorithmes dans les systèmes pour garantir leur bonne intégration à la solution. Enfin, vous pourrez être amené·e à valoriser les résultats à travers des conférences, brevets ou via des publications scientifiques, ainsi qu’à collaborer avec des experts du domaine notamment en montant des collaborations avec des laboratoires académiques

Le poste est à pourvoir à partir de septembre, en CDI, à Paris, avec une possibilité de télétravail partiel. Le full remote avec des déplacements réguliers sur Paris, est envisageable si vous êtes basé en dehors de la région parisienne.

Profil

Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme de doctorat vous ayant permis de développer des compétences en NLP. Vous justifiez d’une expérience de recherche avérée sur les nouvelles approches NLP et êtes familier·e avec BERT et sa famille, idéalement CamemBERT. Vous êtes à l'aise avec la programmation en Python et les bibliothèques d'apprentissage machine (PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow). Vous disposez d’un intérêt particulier pour les avancées technologiques informatiques, les data sciences, la culture de l’IA et plus largement pour la communauté open source.

Votre réactivité, votre esprit critique et votre autonomie, alliés à un fort esprit d’équipe seront des atouts indispensables dans un contexte de cycle d’innovation très court, vous permettant de voir vos features exposées rapidement aux clients. Vous êtes doté·e d’un bon sens de l’écoute et du partage de l’information. Vous aimez les challenges et souhaitez intégrer une équipe dynamique tout en mettant en pratique votre expertise dans le domaine de la NLP.  Vous êtes motivé·e par l’idée de repousser les limites de la connaissance. Votre anglais est professionnel.

Si l’idée de pousser l'état de l'art à l'interface entre deep learning et NLP, et d’accompagner la montée en puissance d’un projet résolument tourné vers la communauté vous motive, envoyez-nous votre candidature sans plus tarder à Adoc Talent Management.

name: Data Scientist/ Software Developer (F/M)
description:
Entreprise 

Adoc Talent Management recrute pour son client un Data Scientist / Software Developer F/M. Notre client est une startup qui révolutionne les approches in silico en support au drug discovery via la création d’un jumeau digital de la cellule, grâce à une combinaison de technologies de rupture à la croisée de l’intelligence artificielle, de l’ingénierie des systèmes et de l’analyse des données omics. Forte de collaborations avec des leaders du secteur pharmaceutique et les meilleurs laboratoires académiques du domaine, la société renforce aujourd’hui son équipe.

Poste 


En tant que Data Scientist / Software Developer, vous interagirez avec une équipe interdisciplinaire. Véritable contributeur clé dans l'expansion de la plateforme, vos missions et responsabilités porteront sur :

- Collaborer étroitement avec les chercheurs et les autres ingénieurs logiciels pour développer les solutions.
- Concevoir, tester, coder, livrer et maintenir les modules logiciels dans un environnement agile scrum.
- Brainstormer avec les équipes pour résoudre des problèmes qui augmenteront considérablement l'expérience utilisateur.
- La résolution des problèmes complexes des clients

Le poste, offrant une réelle autonomie dans ses missions, est à pourvoir au plus vite, en CDI, à Paris, mais peut tout à fait être envisagé en télétravail depuis une autre localisation en France ou à l’international.

Profil 


Vous êtes titulaire d’une formation scientifique/académique, et avez un solide intérêt pour le développement logiciel avec des plateformes web complexes, également pour la mise en œuvre d'algorithmes scientifiques et de services web, et enfin pour le développement back et front-end.
Vous disposez d’une expérience significative (5/10 ans) dans les pratiques de développement logiciel telles que la collecte des exigences, les questions de sécurité et la rédaction de documentation logicielle. Vous disposez également des compétences techniques suivantes :

- Compétences significatives avec Python, R, FastAPI, Ray, Plotly, SQLAlchemy.
- Data Science : Sklearn, Jupyter, PyTorch, Seaborn, Matplotlib.
- Extensions de Jupyter Notebook
- Full stack : React.js, Django, FastAPI, Kubernetes, GCP, PostgreSQL.

Multi-interlocuteurs, vous avez déjà géré une équipe de techniciens et avez travaillé dans une équipe interdisciplinaire. Vous avez également l'habitude de parler de votre activité avec des non-techniciens.
Vous êtes autonome et capable de construire votre propre feuille de route.

Envoyez votre candidature (CV, dépôt GitHub, motivations et prétentions salariales) à Adoc Talent Management sans plus attendre !

name: Game Software Developer/Développeur de Jeux
description:
**** ENGLISH VERSION FOLLOWS ****

Nous recrutons, pour une entreprise internationale spécialisée dans la simulation et la visualisation interactive, un Développeur de jeux ayant une expérience professionnelle dans le développement d'applications en temps réel, de jeux ou de moteurs de simulation, et un intérêt pour les modèles et les conceptions architecturales logicielles. Le candidat retenu serait intégré dans l'équipe de R&D logicielle.

Responsabilités:

  • Travailler dans un environnement Agile.
  • Faire la contribution au développement des simulateurs développées avec les engins de jeux Unity et Unreal.
  • Faire la collaboration au sein d'un groupe multidisciplinaire de programmeurs, d'ingénieurs mécanique, de concepteurs de niveaux et de spécialistes en assurances qualités.
  • Faire le dévelopment des fonctionnalités dans ces champs de compétence:
    • Conception des outils pour les developpeurs de simulation facilitant la gestion du GamePlay, les interfaces usagers et diverses animations.
    • Participation aux revues de code des développeurs de simulation.
    • Assistance à l'équipe de simulation à l'automatisation des tests.
    • Amélioration la gestion du contenu de simulation.
    • Participation à la revue d'architecture du contenu de simulation
  • Participation au processus de développement :
    • Définition la portée et estimation les tâches avec l'équipe.
    • Proposition, discussion et révision des conceptions avec l'équipe.
    • Programmation les fonctionnalités et les tests associés.
    • Révision du code et de celui des autres développeurs.
    • Fourniture la documentation de l'utilisateur final.

Qualifications:

  • Baccalauréat en informatique ou en génie logiciel ou expérience équivalente.
  • Plus de 2 ans d'expérience dans le développement de logiciels dans le domaine des jeux ou de la simulation.
  • Bonne connaissance des langages de programmation tels que C++ et C# et des langages de programmation orientés objet.
  • Excellente connaissance du développement avec au moins un moteur de jeu commercial comme Unity ou Unreal
  • Expérience du développement de jeux dans les domaines du gameplay, de l'interface utilisateur et de l'animation.
  • Bonne connaissance des principes d'assurance qualité des logiciels.
  •  Anglais ou français (parlé et écrit)

Atouts:

  • Expérience de la création et de la maintenance d'outils réutilisables.
  • Connaissance des langages de script, en particulier Python.
  • Expérience du développement d'applications sur la plate-forme Windows.
  • Expérience de la méthodologie Agile et Scrum.
  • Bilingue français & anglais

_____________________________________________________________________
We are recruiting for an international company specializing in simulation and interactive visualization, a Game Software Developer with professional experience in developing real-time applications, games, or simulation engines, and an interest in software architectural models and designs. The successful candidate would be integrated into the software R&D team.

Responsibilities:

  • Working within an Agile environment.
  • Contributing to the development of simulators developed with the Unity and Unreal game engines.
  • Collaborating within a multidisciplinary group of programmers, mechanical engineers, level designers, and quality assurance specialists.
  • Developing functionality in these areas of expertise:
    • Designing tools for simulation developers to facilitate GamePlay management, user interfaces, and various animations.
    • Participating in code reviews of simulation developers.
    • Assisting the simulation team in test automation.
    • Improving the management of the simulation content.
    • Participating in the architecture review of the simulation content.
  • Participating in the development process:
    • Defining scope and estimating tasks with the team.
    • Proposing, discussing, and reviewing designs with the team.
    • Programming the features and associated tests.
    • Reviewing the code and that of other developers.
    • Providing end-user documentation.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering or equivalent experience.
  • More than 2 years of experience in software development in the field of games or simulation.
  • Good knowledge of programming languages such as C++ and C#, and object-oriented programming languages.
  • Excellent understanding of development with at least one commercial game engine such as Unity or Unreal
  • Experience developing games in the areas of gameplay, user interface, and animation.
  • Good knowledge of software quality assurance principles.
  • English or French (spoken and written)

Assets:

  • Experienced in creating and maintaining reusable tools.
  • Knowledge of scripting languages, specifically Python.
  • Experienced in developing applications on the Windows platform.
  • Experienced in working with Agile and Scrum methodology.
  • Bilingual (French & English)

name: R&D Software Graphics Developer/ Développeur Graphique R&D
description:
**** ENGLISH VERSION FOLLOWS ****

Nous recrutons, pour une entreprise internationale spécialisée dans la simulation et la visualisation interactive, un Développeur de Logiciels Graphiques pour l'équipe de R&D, ayant une expérience professionnelle dans le développement de logiciels d'applications en temps réel, de jeux ou de moteurs de simulation, et un intérêt pour les modèles architecturaux et les conceptions logicielles.

_____________________________________________________________________
We are recruiting, for an international company specialized in simulation and interactive visualization, a Software Graphics Developer for the R&D team, with professional experience in the development of real-time application software, games or simulation engines, and an interest in architectural models and software designs.

Responsibilities:

  • To work within an Agile team.
  • To contribute to the development of applications and tools for the simulation software platform.
  • To cooperate within a cross-functional group of programmers, mechanical engineers, level designers, and quality assurance specialists.
  • To implement features that are related to:
